page.syntax: Output_Date_Time as C = a5_convert_datetime_string(C datetimestring ,C InDateFormat ,C OutDateFormat [,C separator ])

argument.name: datetimestring
argument.description: The original data string, containing values for year, month, day, hours, and minutes.

argument.name: InDateFormat
argument.description: A character string containing the letters "Y", "M", and "D" that indicates the sequence of input values.

argument.name: OutDateFormat
argument.description: A character string containing the letters "Y", "M", and "D" that indicates the sequence of output values.

argument.name: separator
argument.description: The character(s) to place between the year, month, and day values.

page.description: Converts a datetime string from one format to another. E.g. from DMY format to YMD format.
page.discussion: The A5_CONVERT_DATETIME_STRING() function reformats a date portion of a date time string.
